conclusion: The particle with mass 2m and charge q deviates by d from the straight path, use circular motion and Lorentz force to find kinetic energy.
The particle experiences a magnetic force F = qvB causing circular motion.
The radius of circular path is given by r = mv/qB.
Since the particle deviates by d, the radius of the circular path is r = d.
Substituting r = d into the radius formula gives d = 2mv/qB.
Solving for v gives v = qBd/2m.
Kinetic energy Ek is given by Ek = 1/2 mv^2.
Substituting v = qBd/2m into kinetic energy formula gives Ek = 1/2(2m)(qBd/2m)^2.
The kinetic energy Ek of the particle when it leaves N is q^2B^2d^2/4m.
